The city Esteco seemed doomed to destruction, unless the continual hostilities of the Mocobios were put a stop to. Alfonzo Mercado, Go- vernor of Tucuman‚ thinking that peace might be more easily obtained without war, sent two J esuits to pacify the Mocobios, and these legates were able to obtain, by sair words, what those who sent them could never have extorted by the sword. The savages promised peace, and maintained it, whilst Mercado was Governor of Tucuman‚ but receiving information that he had been succeeded by Angelo de Paredo, they renewed their hostilities.
